thread.title: Panizza's goals lift Randolph in OT
thread.title_full: Panizza's goals lift Randolph in OT

title: Panizza's goals lift Randolph in OT
text:
Panizza's goals lift Randolph in OT Jane Havsy , @dailyrecordspts 10:23 p.m. EDT October 18, 2015 Buy Photo Randolph celebrates the win over Mount Olive in a Morris County Tournament semifinal. (Photo: Ed Pagliarini/Correspondent) Buy Photo 74 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
MOUNTAIN LAKES - Heading into overtime in a Morris County Tournament semifinal, Mateo Panizza knew the Randolph boys soccer team was "struggling." Down a man after a late red card, the Rams needed a spark. 
Panizza, a senior captain who moved up to striker late in Sunday's match, decided to take on that role himself. In the huddle between regulation and OT, Panizza told his teammates, "It doesn't matter if we're a man down. We have more heart." 
The Rams showed it, as junior midfielder Michael Lauria kept playing the ball despite losing a shoe â€” setting Panizza up for the winning goal. Panizza's low shot from the left side hit the woodwork at the bottom of the goal and ricocheted back, but it had already crossed the line. 
Randolph's bench cleared, celebrating a 2-1 overtime defeat of Mount Olive in the MCT semi. Buy Photo Morris County Tournament boys soccer semifinals.
